scsi_id is primarily for use by other utilities such as udev that re quire a unique SCSI identifier. scsi_id is primarily for use by other utilities such as udev that re quire a unique SCSI identifier.
By default all devices are assumed black listed, the --whitelisted o ption must be specified on the command line or in the config file for any u seful behaviour. By default all devices are assumed black listed, the --whitelisted o ption must be specified on the command line or in the config file for any u seful behaviour.
SCSI commands are sent directly to the device via the SG_IO ioctl in terface. SCSI commands are sent directly to the device via the SG_IO ioctl in terface.
In order to generate unique values for either page 0x80 or page 0x83 , the serial numbers or world wide names are prefixed as follows. In order to generate unique values for either page 0x80 or page 0x83 , the serial numbers or world wide names are prefixed as follows.
Identifiers based on page 0x80 are prefixed by the character 'S', th e SCSI vendor, the SCSI product (model) and then the the serial number retu rned by page 0x80. For example: Identifiers based on page 0x80 are prefixed by the character 'S', th e SCSI vendor, the SCSI product (model) and then the the serial number retu rned by page 0x80. For example:
# /lib/udev/scsi_id --page=0x80 --whitelisted --device=/dev/sda # /usr/lib/udev/scsi_id --page=0x80 --whitelisted --device=/dev/sda
SIBM 3542 1T05078453 SIBM 3542 1T05078453
Identifiers based on page 0x83 are prefixed by the identifier type f ollowed by the page 0x83 identifier. For example, a device with a NAA (Name Address Authority) type of 3 (also in this case the page 0x83 identifier s tarts Identifiers based on page 0x83 are prefixed by the identifier type f ollowed by the page 0x83 identifier. For example, a device with a NAA (Name Address Authority) type of 3 (also in this case the page 0x83 identifier s tarts
with the NAA value of 6): with the NAA value of 6):
# /lib/udev/scsi_id --page=0x83 --whitelisted --device=/dev/sda # /usr/lib/udev/scsi_id --page=0x83 --whitelisted --device=/dev/sda
3600a0b80000b174b000000d63efc5c8c 3600a0b80000b174b000000d63efc5c8c
OPTIONS OPTIONS
--blacklisted --blacklisted
The default behaviour - treat the device as black listed, and do nothing unless a white listed device is found in the scsi_id config-fil e. The default behaviour - treat the device as black listed, and do nothing unless a white listed device is found in the scsi_id config-fil e.
--device=device --device=device
Send SG_IO commands to device, such as /dev/sdc. Send SG_IO commands to device, such as /dev/sdc.
--config=config-file --config=config-file
